intro: Glochidion disparipes, commonly known as the Malayan glabrous leaflet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually glabrous or nearly so. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Glochidion disparipes is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, tropical conditions.
